utterances.utterance: Due process.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: How does all of this - both scandals make you feel living in Virginia?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Pretty upset, I feel pretty let down. I was at the convention with - when Obama was vouching for all these people and I can't imagine how he feels right now.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right. Here with reaction are Fox News Contributors, Lawrence Jones, Special Hannity Correspondent and Tammy Bruce is with us. Tammy, you were amazing - your commentary, your passion during the whole Kavanaugh hearings was - you really were on target. You know what words I haven't heard yet as it relates to the Lieutenant Governor scandal from very prominent people that were so quick to rush to judgment, I'm not hearing anyone say, "I Believe".

utterances.speaker: TAMMY BRUCE, CONTRIBUTOR, INDEPENDENT WOMEN'S VOICE PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: Yes. And, look, this is absolutely predictable. And this is what destroys the issue for all of us who cared about it. Who care about every woman who is genuinely sexually assaulted, has a horrible experience at work, wants the justice system to work for her, wants to be heard, wants to be taken seriously and that was our conversation during Kavanaugh. What wasn't it Sean? That attack on Brett Kavanaugh set this essay.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Bludgeoning.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: It was a political weapon. It was a serious issue weaponized. And yet it - we knew it was also going to destroy the credibility of the nature of the issue itself we fought for so long. And now we have a woman - and look, my argument that entire time was to take women seriously. But you don't just automatically believe everyone in accuser. That's what due process is for, and that's what women have asked for. And now, this woman in this case, is being looked at. And the Democrats for some reason are treating her as though she can't be believed. So the American people are looking at this and they're seeing the double standard. And they're thinking then, that the issue doesn't really matter. The issue is a political one. You can't trust what women are saying about men or about politicians, and this is courtesy of the Democrat Party. It is courtesy of a party that says they're the champions for women and within a few short months they have burnt it to the ground. And women have to realize that whenever one party says to you, we're going to save your lives, you can only trust us, watch out, watch your back, because they're going to weaponize the thing.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me ask Lawrence this, because you were right. If they really cared about the issue, Lawrence, I think, they'd be saying, "I believe". They're not saying that. Just like in the hell - just like on the border debate. They once supported a border wall. They said they cared about Dreamers. That they cared about DACA, that they cared about furloughed employees. But they wouldn't even talk to the President. And the same thing - I would imagine the controversy if it was Republicans and blackface - I would imagine their reaction would be very different on that one too.

utterances.speaker: LAWRENCE JONES, CONTRIBUTOR, CAMPUS REFORM EDITOR-IN-CHIEF
utterances.utterance: That's exactly right, Sean. And the guy this - he probably can't sleep in his mansion behind me. The Governor played a lot of politics. Made a lot of accusations in his last race about the Republican opponent. Meanwhile, this guy is in blackface. And this is what the Democratic Party does. They play these race games. Deep down there's a lot of Dixiecrats out there that are cold blooded racists. But they play these games. And I'd like to say this, Sean. I don't want these guys to resign. Stay there, because we know that you guys are going to play the same game in 2020, and now we have proof that the Democrats aren't calling for these guys to resign. They're not calling from them to resign. They want them to stay there.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: In the Obama years, the people - when I always say 13 million more Americans on food stamps, 8 million more in poverty. The people that were most disproportionately impacted, African-Americans, Hispanic Americans and women. The people that are benefiting--

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --the most on the - of the conservative policies of Donald Trump, look at the record low unemployment, those same three demographics and Asian Americans and youth unemployment.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Sean, can I add one thing here?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: For the women out there watching this and watching all of this unfold, they have to realize that they've been lied to by the Democratic Party, and that is they listen now to other arguments moving into these next two years, when it comes to the quality of their lives improving. That to take a step back and to relook at what it is they've been told to think about, the President and about what's happening in the country, and what's in their best interest. In their best interest right now is to operate as independents and is to listen with some cynicism and suspicion to what Democrats tell them.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right, we're running out of time. Last word Lawrence, we only have about 15 seconds.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: And the Republic - and the - yes, and the Republicans can no longer be afraid. They got to go into different communities and sell our agenda, because--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: How do we loose of these guys?

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Bravo.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: How do we lose to these guys? These guys wearing blackface?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm a conservative. I believe god created every man, woman and child. And when you live in freedom, we can create a standard of living second to none, and God-given talent comes out of every human. That's simple. All right, guys, good. Thank you both. When we come back a bombshell report exposing Congressman Adam Schiff, has to do with something important, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. We have another explosive report from The Hill's John Solomon detailing an encounter between House Intel Committee Chairman that would be Adam Shifty Schiff, one of the biggest liars in Congress and Fusion GPS, Founder Glenn Simpson. They met in beautiful Aspen, Colorado as our "Hannity Watch" on the Deep State begins tonight. And remember, Fusion GPS was the firm that hired Christopher Steele, put together the phony dossier paid for by Clinton with Russian lies. That the FBI never verified or corroborated to spy on Trump campaign associate, Carter Page, which fueled the fake collusion narrative that Senate Intel Chair, Richard Burr today - pay attention, that's the Senate Intel Committee, zero evidence for. Joining us with reaction, John Solomon of The Hill, author of "The Russian Hoax"; Fox News Legal Analyst, Gregg Jarrett. All right, let's go slowly here, John. Last night you detailed how Robert Mueller, when he was the FBI Director, was brought before the FISA Judges--

utterances.speaker: JOHN SOLOMON, THE HILL EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT, THE HILL INVESTIGATIVE COLUMNIST
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --and excoriated for the FBI's behavior in some 75 cases of withholding exculpatory evidence. OK. We know that they withheld. That they never told the FISA Court Hillary paid for this. They never verified it, they never corroborated it, and they were warned in August by Bruce Ohr all of them, correct? And Andrew Weissmann, the "Pit Bull", knew about all this, because he was briefed by Ohr also?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: That's right, yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What's new about Schiff?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: Well, Adam Schiff has been the biggest champion in Congress for the dossier - right for two years until just recently when he raised the possibility that they might move on from Russia to some other things, right? But, let's remember - let's take everybody back to the spring of 2017. Devin Nunes then House Intelligence Committee Chairman goes to the White House, exercises his oversight responsibility, tries to find about some unmasking abuses and Adam Schiff goes banana. "This is an abuse. He didn't tell the Committee. He can't be trusted. This taints our whole investigation", right? Remember that? And Devin Nunes stepped aside for a while, had to undergo an ethics investigation, was cleared. Well let's fast forward to this summer. Adam Schiff is at The Aspen Institute. Who's he meeting with? The author of the dossier, and he is there talking with Glenn Simpson. And this is at a time when Schiff's Committee and Nunes' Committee knows it's highly possible that there's been lies in his testimony. He has a meeting. He doesn't tell anybody in the Committee. It isn't until I find this photo in the last couple days showing them together, that we now learn that they had this meeting. And my favorite line in this is, when asked what this meeting was about, Glenn Simpson said, "Oh, it was just a small talk meeting. I considered what Ernie and Bert do on Sesame Street, small talk. I don't think the author of the dossier and the Chairman of the House Intelligence Committee can be engaged in small talk. It's a very significant event.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Gregg Jarrett, you go back and we've learned that Mueller - we have William Campbell. We had an FBI undercover agent in Putin's network in America on the Uranium One scandal, chronicling back bribery, extortion, kickbacks, money laundering. OK. GREGG JARRETT, LEGAL ANALYST, "THE RUSSIA HOAX" AUTHOR: That's true.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Everybody was warned, including Robert Mueller's "Pit Bull" that this was not verified. They still committed a fraud before the FISA Court four times, Rod Rosenstein signing the last one.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And I'm looking at this and now that we know that Robert Mueller was excoriated for withholding exculpatory evidence for the FBI in 75 cases and they did it in this case. When is anybody going to be held accountable for all this these Russian lies that they know Hillary paid for from day one, but yet they went with an investigation on Trump?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Well, maybe next week when William Barr is approved and sworn in as the next Attorney General. He's vowed to get to the bottom of this. But today's big story, as you mentioned it, in your monologue, Sean is. Senator Burr who said we have - we don't have anything that would suggest there was collusion by the Trump campaign and Russia. Now that's incredibly important, because not only did his Committee interview more than 200 witnesses and examined more than 300,000 pages of documents. But his, Committee, unlike Robert Mueller, has direct access to intelligence information that's classified. So Burr's forthcoming report saying there's no evidence of collusion--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He wouldn't say if we knew--

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: --is far more reliable than anything Robert Mueller will come up with.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He's seen it all. Now, I'm thinking about. We just played at the beginning of the show, John - Adam Schiff, we'll you write about and expose today meeting - what a conflict of interest. Now they can deny all they want. "Well, we just happened to meet. We never talked about anything seriously". I don't believe anything that comes out of Adam Schiff's mouth. I think he's a liar and he's been lying the whole time about all this for political gain. Adam Schiff is on tape talking to a person he believes to be a Russian to dig dirt on Donald Trump. How does he dare get to investigate anybody about Russian collusion, when he's on tape doing it?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: It's a great question. And if he applies the same standard to himself that he applied to Devin Nunes two years ago, he should step aside. He should subject himself to an ethics investigation. But tonight, after all these allegations out, after everybody has seen the photos, there's crickets from Republicans and there's crickets from Democrats, that's the problem in Washington. People aren't willing to stand up anymore and demand accountability, and that's what has to happen. And I agree with Gregg that the next opportunity is Bill Barr in a week.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I hope the President picked the right guy. I don't know Bill Barr. But if we have a FBI spy in the Uranium One deal and they're - we know they're involved in crimes, and we do nothing, and then Hillary gets all this money to the Clinton Foundation, Hillary bought and paid for Russian dossier, lies, everybody's warned about it, becomes the bulk of information for FISA. When Gregg - when is their accountability?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Well, as I say, Bill Barr can not only launch an investigation into Comey's corruption at the FBI and all of his acolytes. But he can take a serious examination of criminal investigation into the conduct of Hillary Clinton and her Foundation. Not to mention, re-examining Comey's decision to absolve her under espionage charges in the e-mail scandal.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Thank you both. Great work. Now this is beginning to blow wide open. I told you there's a lot - there is a lot more coming. All right. When we come back, we told you the scary proposals in the Green New Deal, everything's free. Well, directly ahead we're going to set the record straight, Joe Bastardi, Christopher Horner. And we have a Hollywood, "Villain of the Day" - famous Hollywood star. You won't believe. You can't even make this up, it's so insane. Straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and other Democrats unveiling their radical extreme Green New Deal today to address, what she calls "Catastrophic Climate Change", the world's going to end in 12 years. "Scary-O", I'm calling her. Anyway, here to get the latest on whether this is the right decision based on the right science, is the Competitive Enterprise Institute Senior Fellow Christopher Horner; weatherbell.com, Chief Meteorologist, our friend, Joe Bastardi. OK. Chris, let's start with you. You've written a number of books on the subject. If we're going to offer - we're going to demand every business and house in the country be rebuilt. If we're going to offer free college, free housing, free healthcare, free retirement, free, free, - everything's free. And the reasoning is we're going to - the Earth's going to end in 12 years, so I'll do this in 10 years with only two years to benefit from it. That's going to cost trillions and trillions and destroy capitalism, the energy, healthcare industries and so many others. Good idea?

utterances.speaker: CHRISTOPHER HORNER, COMPETITIVE ENTERPRISE INSTITUTE SENIOR FELLOW
utterances.utterance: Right, because it's worked not in those places President Obama used to tell us to look to, to see how it would work out, when he tried baby steps toward this "Wrenching transformation of society", as Al Gore called it. We used to be the only ones not doing it, now we're told, "Well, we'll be the first". You'll see this this plan opens with the alarmist liturgy, but then it did reels off page after page of what you noted this this progressive boilerplate about guaranteed income and so on for those unwilling to work. There's no mention of a climate impact. There's no mention of a change in temperature, which is the flag it sails in under. But there's no one who actually claims it would impact the climate. This is about the fundamental transformation. You'll see in The Washington Post tomorrow a scathing editorial pointing out that you're trashing the enterprise of the climate industry here by going off on your massive project. Meanwhile, they claim it would cure these social ills. It would exacerbate badly all of them through energy poverty.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The 1970s--

utterances.speaker: HORNER
utterances.utterance: --killing jobs, energy, poverty and so on.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Joe, the 70s was, the nice new Ice Age is coming. Then global warming with the Earth has the temperature and it's going to explode in a number of years that passed already. Now we just say climate change, but it's really predicated on what, a battle against capitalism? The premise that that man on Earth is pillaging the planet for profit?

utterances.speaker: JOE BASTARDI, WEATHERBELL.COM CHIEF METEOROLOGIST
utterances.utterance: Well, first of all, H.L. Mencken who was a Democrat said it correctly. "The urge to save humanity is almost always a false face for the urge to rule it", and I think that's what you're seeing here today. What gets me is, and I wrote a book on, as you know Sean. You're dragging the majesty of the creation - weather, climate, all these things I've loved since I was a kid, being dragged through the mud. It's the weaponization of weather, the weaponization of climate. The idea that the average person doesn't know what happened in the 70s or the 30s or the 40s or the 50s - like - people like me, what they do is they simply take advantage of it. And I almost have to laugh at it now because you would have to sell your soul to that world to understand that world, and that's exactly what's going on here. It's really not that much. Look, I understand the CO2 feedback argument. But the oceans have 99.9 percent of the heat capacity of the entire system. If the ocean cyclically warm, the air cyclically warms. When the oceans cool, the air will cool.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The last thing I got to say this, Joe--

utterances.speaker: BASTARDI
utterances.utterance: That's a pretty simple relationship.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know every storm, you've studied weather and Chris you have studied this. People need to pay attention a little bit to what you're saying. Thank you both. All right you're not going to believe tonight's "Villain of the Day", you're hint famous Hollywood liberal, it's insane. Straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Tonight's "Villain of the Day", Hollywood liberal. After President Trump called out the Left's radical late-term, even up to birth abortion policies in the State of the Union, Bette Midler tweeted, I quote, "Buy stock in coat hangers! Here we go, 60 years, back to the back alleys!" Disgusting, inaccurate, untrue. All right. Before we go tonight, some extremely sad news to share with you, our longtime friend, our colleague Bob Massi, attorney, expert real estate passed away after a pretty long battle with cancer, 67 years old. We send our prayers, our thoughts to him and his family. Very generous man. Every time I hit a golf ball, I used a driver, he sent me. He was just that type of guy and he will be missed. We are praying for his family tonight. Also we did learn tonight that Former Michigan Congressman Democrat, John Dingell, that he died at the age of 92. Democrat was the longest serving member of Congress in the history of this country, 1955 through January 2015. We send our thoughts and prayers to his family. All right. The show will never be the hate-Trump media. Let not your heart be troubled. Laura Ingraham is standing by in the swamp. I'm not there tonight.
